## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}

#install.packages("ggmap")
#install.packages("stringr")
#install.packages("viridis")

library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggmap)
library(stringr)
library(viridis)
library(mapdata)

data <- read.csv("IUCN_final.csv")

data <- data.frame(data)



```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}

data_2000 <- data%>%
  filter(year == "2000")


us <- map_data("usa")
data %>% glimpse()

map1 <- ggplot() +
  geom_point(data = data_2000, aes(x = decimalLongitude, y = decimalLatitude), alpha = .05)

map2 <- ggplot(us, aes(x = long, y = lat, group = group)) +
  geom_polygon()

map3 <- ggplot() +
  stat_density2d(data = data_2000, aes(x = decimalLongitude, y = decimalLatitude, fill = ..density..),
                 geom = 'tile', contour = F)


ggplot() +
  geom_polygon(data = us, aes(x = long, y = lat, group = group)) + xlim(-130,-60) + 
  scale_fill_viridis(option = 'inferno') +
  stat_density2d(data = data_2000, 
                 aes(x = decimalLongitude, y = decimalLatitude, fill = ..density..), 
                 geom = 'tile', contour = FALSE, alpha = 0.5)



#USA_gbif <- occ_download_get(key = "0195350-230224095556074", overwrite = TRUE) 

```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

```{plot}
                 geom = 'tile', contour = F)

```
